page.title: 17LAW AND ORDER
page.content: The new Bridgwater police station was built in 1966. There are 80 policemen and four policewomen. The policewomen visit schools. There is one Chief Inspector, four inspectors, one superintendent, eleven sergeants and a number of C.I.D. men. In 1984 there were 3000 bicycles stolen. There are not many robberies in shops but there are a lot of burglaries. Stray dogs are sometimes found and are put in the kennels at the station. There are six cells, two for women and four for the men. There is a low bed for the drunks, the rest are high. There are toilets which have their flush outside in case the prisoners damage them. There is a yard outside for the prisoners to exercise. When we went to the police station we had our fingerprints taken.
